revised_title: The Early Printers to the Royal Society: 1663-1708
tldr: The article discusses the early printers to the Royal Society from 1663 to 1708, focusing on John Martyn and James Allestry. It explains how they were appointed as printers and their responsibilities, as well as their roles in publishing works related to the Royal Society. The article also provides background information on Martyn and Allestry, their careers as booksellers, and their experiences during the Great Fire of London.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
